feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Updates on ODATA V2 Deprecation
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I have confusion on latest rumors' on stopping support for ODATA v2 from SAP. I am not really finding any SAP note on that to get clear idea. Can someone help me to get it and also do you have idea on below points?

  • If ODATA v2 support is going to stop then what will happen to old service/integrations done with non-sap systems after system upgrade?
  • Are ODATA services created through SEGW comes under ODATA v2?
  • If creating ODATA services is not recommended in SEGW then how same can be done in v4 version(may be following RAP Model)?(Any blog or documentation on creating READ, UPDATE, CREATE Operations in ODATA v4 same like how we were doing in SEGW?)

Thanks for your time in reading my queries, please drop ur comments.

Regards,

Omkar

entry.title: Private cloud implementation notes for license
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

This is for private cloud customer which already live on wave 1 in 2025.  I could check the licences in their quality system which have roles in there and they will go live on 2nd wave in 2026 April. 

They want to check the licence implications before these are moved to production.  Do they need to implement the note that is currently in their production system in order to perform this?  Also is it possible to check in Dev also?

Thanks in advance

Helinna

entry.title: Budget Availability Control for Projects - S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

so I observe the following: Under SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud I cannot use Budget Availability Control for Projects | SAP Help Portal as it is provided under Public Cloud Solution. However, I can use the new Cost Center Budget Control, thats based on ACDOCP.

Does that mean, under Private Cloud solutions, I can only use the old project and order budget availability control thats based on the old BP* tables?

That would entail no Fiori reporting or any other budget control apps like I have it for Cost Centers, right?

Please tell me I'm wrong and that I'm missing something.

Kind regards

Alex

entry.title: Managing Vehicles in SAP Asset Management and SAP SSAM
entry.content:
Dear Colleagues,

I am currently working on a requirement related to vehicle management within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management and SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM).

Could you please advise if there are any standard capabilities available for managing vehicles that can be leveraged by technicians in both SAP Asset Management and SSAM?

Regarding SSAM specifically, I reviewed the Features and Personas Configuration Matrix but could not find any relevant features : https://help.sap.com/docs/service-asset-manager/sap-service-and-asset-manager-configuration-guide/features-and-personas-configuration-matrix?locale=en-US

Have you encountered this requirement in previous projects?

Your insights would be greatly appreciated.

Kind regards,

SAP Service and Asset Manager PLM Enterprise Asset Management (EAM)/Plant Maintenance (PM) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

entry.title: Get the price for a material without simulating sales order
entry.content: We want to get the price of a material without simulating the sales order via BAPI. Currently we are using BAPI_PIQ_SDPRICELIST  to get the net price of a material but it is simulating the sales order and providing the price which is causing the performance issue. We need it for multiple materials at one go but it is taking longer time. is there anyway we can get the net price directly from the table rather than BAPI.

entry.title: Inspection lot quantity overflow
entry.content:
Hello Team,

Figure -1 shows the entry with QA32. The highlighted area correctly displays a quantity (Qty) of 41,400.

However, when performing Result Recording for that lot, the inspected quantity in the Inspect field only shows 32,767 (see Figure -2).

Sampling is set to 100%. All Master Data is correct.

The issue is as follows: if the quantity is less than 32,767, there is no issue. If the quantity is greater than 32,767, the Inspect field in Figure -2 only shows 32,767.
Can you please explain why this is happening? Any suggestions please.

Thanks & Best Regards,

Nyi Nyi Htway

entry.title: Questions regarding S/4HANA Upgrade for SAP PCE Customer (Basis Perspective)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am a Basis consultant from an SAP Partner and we have a customer currently on SAP Private Cloud Edition (PCE) who is planning an S/4HANA upgrade. I have a few questions regarding the project structure, roles, and technical aspects specific to the PCE environment.

I appreciate any insights you can provide!

My Questions:
Project Leadership & Collaboration:

In an SAP PCE S/4HANA upgrade project, does SAP also assign a Project Leader/Manager role to work collaboratively with the SAP Partner to manage the customer system upgrade?

Scope and Responsibility Documentation:

Is there any official documentation available for SAP Partners that clearly outlines the division of responsibilities (SAP vs. Partner) and the specific tasks/scope of work the Partner is required to execute during the PCE upgrade process?

Common Basis Challenges/Issues:

What are the common or foreseeable Basis-related challenges/issues (e.g., specific to the PCE environment, migration, or technical configuration) that we should anticipate and prepare for during an SAP PCE S/4HANA upgrade project?

Thank you in advance for your time and expertise!

entry.title: Sales order creation from cxml document
entry.content:
Hello,

We have one customer who is using a P2P solution which is able to send his purchase order as PO Cxml message. The objective is to create a sales document (sales order or sales quotation #S4/HANA SD#) using this cxml document.

I know we can deliver using ABAP code but I didn't find any standard way to proceed. I have even looked into SAP Business Network but resources related to sell side is not clear. 

Have I missed something ?

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit What’s New in 2025?
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit What’s New in 2025? Sequence Information View

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Recommendation - Project Setup

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Note: Please touch base with Basis or Development team to implement all required SAP correction notes prior to using the DMC tool for avoiding lot of errors and related to performance issues.

You can use the SAP Note Analyzer (transaction CNV_NA_MC) to check whether all the necessary SAP Notes for
SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit are installed. For more information, see SAP Note 3016862

How to implement the latest corrections released for Migration cockpit

SAP Fiori must be set up as prerequisite for the data migration approaches. For more information about the
SAP Fiori app Migrate Your Data, see:

 SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library and search for the SAP Fiori app Migrate Your Data
• SAP Note 3039598

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library

App ID: F3473 - Migrate Your Data - Migration Cockpit

App ID: F3280 - Data Migration Status

App ID: 7829 - Analyze Your Selection Process (This app is only relevant for the migration approach Migrate Data Directly from SAP System.)

 Migration Cockpit (Transaction LTMC) - Deprecated

The app Migrate Your Data - Migration Cockpit is the successor of the Migration Cockpit (Transaction LTMC) app. The Migration Cockpit (transaction LTMC) app is deprecated and can no longer be used to migrate data to SAP S/4HANA. However, you can still view any projects that you created when using this app.

Refer the below links for more details 

3016862 - DMIS Note Analyzers with separated scenarios for ABAP-based Migration and Replication Technology (DMIS2011/DMIS2018/DMIS2020/SAP S/4HANA) - SAP for Me

INST_OP2023.pdf

SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit - Cookbook - Private Edition - 2023

INST_OP2025.pdf

SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Migrate your Data to SAP S/4HANA -2025

SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Migrate Your Data to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Latest Features in the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, released with 2025 FPS0

 Migration Objects For a complete list of migration objects, see https://help.sap.com/S4_OP_MO

Situation Handling for Data Migration | SAP Help Portal

Video Library for Data Migration | SAP Help Portal

Available Migration Objects | SAP Help Portal

Data Migration Status | SAP Help Portal

 Data Migration | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: S/4Hana SSL handshake with CIG failed
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I meet an issue with 42k scenarios, when sending PO, it cannot send to CIG with this error:

--ERROR_INFO SSL handshake with edge-qa-test.cig.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com:443 failed: SSSLERR_SSL_READ (-58)SAPCRYPTO:SSL_read() failedS

I'm using P-user + password which is the SAP Cloud Integration option, to connect with CIG. 

Here is the error from SRT_MONI. I also checked the cloud connector, the certifications are all valid.

It happens all of a sudden, not aware of any configuration changes, like it works days before and then it doesn't work.

Anyone can help please?

entry.title: WIND entries deleted daily – cause RWDPOSRS_OLD?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am facing an issue with WIND entries related to document category 55 for POS outbound. These entries are being deleted daily, and I suspect this is caused by the report RWDPOSRS_OLD, which we have scheduled to run daily.

I understand that RWDPOSRS_OLD deletes WIND entries, but I am not sure how the program decides which entries to delete. Has anyone experienced this issue or can provide insights on how to determine if and why the doc category 55 entries are being deleted?

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Auto Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Automatic Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Nested Handling Units (HUs) mean packing one Handling Unit inside another Handling Unit.
  • For example, cartons packed into a pallet, where each carton and the pallet have their own HU number.

Step 1: Maintain Packaging Material Types. The menu path is shown in the screenshot below.

Note: I have created 2 Packaging Material types:

  • Pallet
  • Carton

 

Step 2: Define Material group for Packaging Materials

  • Created Packing Material groups for Pallet and Carton.

Step 3: Define Allowed Packaging Materials

  • Map the Packing Material Type with the Packing Material Group

  • Note - For Nested HUs, it is mandatory to cross-map Packing Material Types with Packing Material Groups.

This means:

  • Carton groups must allow pallet types, and
  • Pallet groups must allow carton types,
  • so that inner HUs can be packed into outer HUs without errors.

Step 4: Assign Number Range intervals to Packaging Material Type

  • Assign a number range to the created Packing Material Types for the respective plant and storage location.

Step 5: Created packing materials in MM01 using Material Type VERP and assign the relevant Packing Material Group and Pack. Material Type in the “Matl Grp Pack. Matls, Packing Material type” fields under the Basic Data view/Sales: General Plant data. Additionally, assign the appropriate HU Type and also created SFG Material.

In this scenario, two packing materials are created:

  • CARTONBOX with Packing Material Type CARTON
  • PALLET1 with Packing Material Type PALLET
  • 42 with SFG type.

 

Step 6:  Create Packing Instructions using T-Code: POP1

  • Please note that the Handling Unit (HU) number is generated only for the Load Carrier maintained in a Packaging Instruction.
  • As a result, to generate HUs for both cartons and pallets, each must be defined as a Load Carrier. Since a Packaging Instruction can contain only one Load Carrier, separate Packaging Instructions are required for cartons and pallets.
  • Based on this approach, the following Packaging Instructions have been created:

  • Created Packing Instruction “AutoPack”, added Components for Cotton Box.

 

  • Maintain check profile.

  • Check and save.

  • A separate Packaging Instruction is created for the pallet by adding the PALLET material as Item Category “P” and the AUTOPACK packaging instruction as Item Category “I”. Maintain the required quantities, then check and save.

Step 7: For automatic determination of the Packaging Instruction, create a condition record using T-code POF1.

  • Select “RCPT” standard for Inbound delivery.

  • Assign the SFG material and the ‘PALLET’ Packaging Instruction in the determination record.

Step 8:  Enable Auto Packing in Delivery Types

  • Selected Standard “EL” delivery type for Inbound delivery
  • Enabled “Automatic Packing” and save

The above are the configuration steps. The functional flow is explained below.

  • Created PO by selecting Confirmation key.

  • Create the inbound delivery, select the line item, and click ‘Auto Packing’. The system automatically packs the material.

In this scenario, Material 42 – SFG Material is maintained.

  • Each Carton Box is defined to carry 25 KG of SFG material.
  • Multiple Carton Boxes are then packed into a Pallet, where one pallet contains 4 carton boxes.
  • A Purchase Order is created for 100 KG of 42 SFG material.

During Inbound Delivery Auto Packing, the system performs the packing automatically as follows:

  • 100 KG of SFG material is packed into 4 Carton HUs (25 KG each).
  • These 4 Carton HUs are nested and packed into 1 Pallet HU.

This demonstrates Nested Handling Unit (HU) auto packing, where inner Carton HUs are packed into an outer Pallet HU, and each level is assigned its own HU number automatically by the system.

entry.title: Display DRAFT Watermark on Adobe Form for Unapproved Purchase Orders
entry.content:
I have a requirement to display a DRAFT watermark on all pages of an Adobe form when a Purchase Order is not approved.

Below is the current setup:

  • We are using a custom Adobe form (copied from standard), with layout changes as per business requirements and custom fields added using Fiori applications.

  • The form uses the standard interface SOMU_DEFAULT_INTERFACE and OData service FDP_EF_PURCHASE_ORDER_SRV.

  • Standard output type: PURCHASE_ORDER.

  • We are using New Output Management (OPD, BRF+).

Form structure: Below forms are handled via the Fiori app Output Management Form Template.

  • Master Form: Used to display the logo dynamically based on configuration.

  • Content Form: Used to display transaction data.

What I have tried so far:

  • Placing a DRAFT image directly on the content form disrupts the existing layout (fields/subforms), so this approach did not work as expected.
  • Placing the DRAFT image/text on the master page of the content form shows correctly in design view but does not appear in the PO output.
  • Placing the DRAFT image on the main master form does display it in the PO output; however, I am unable to control its visibility (show/hide) based on the approval status, as the approval data is available only in the content form.

entry.content: If clients are using IM in ECC. Is it recommended to continue using IM in S4 HANA private cloud or switch to SAP PPM. And What is the future of IM for next 5 years. Is SAP going to keep IM in long-run?

entry.title: Clarification on Data Migration Activities – Split Valuation
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to get some clarification regarding the data migration activities for the split valuation activation:

  • For the material master, can we use MM17 to change the valuation category?
  • Is it possible to use Migration Cockpit to create valuation type data in the accounting view? If not, what is the recommended approach?
  • For the stock load with split valuation, can we use Migration Cockpit? If not, what is the best practice?

 

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
